messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Assassination of Ii Naosuke
messages.msgSnippet: Assassination of Ii Naosuke  is called Sakuradamongai no hen (Sakuradamongai incident) Sakuradamon(mon means gate) is one of gates of Edo castle. He was
messages.messageBody:
Assassination of Ii Naosuke is called "Sakuradamongai no hen"
(Sakuradamongai incident)
Sakuradamon(mon means gate) is one of gates of Edo castle.
He was killed at the front of Sakurada gate by Mito and Satsuma clan ronins.
Mito samurai were known as Sonno-Joui(Respect emperor-Anti foreigners)
They were angry at Ii's decision of the Harris Treaty.

http://www.factbites.com/topics/Ii-Naosuke
http://ennui.in/cinderella/pictures/meijirestoration.htm

Pictures of Sakuradamongai no hen.
http://www.archives.pref.fukui.jp/fukui/07/zusetsu/C33/c3324.jpg
http://www.bakumatsu-meiji.com/img/bm_col_sakuradamon.jpg
Woodblock Print(Nishiki-e)
http://www.city.setagaya.tokyo.jp/topics/shospo/siryoukan/image/im_jyousetu13.jpg
Photos of Sakurada gate
http://www.asahi-net.or.jp/~de3m-ozw/shiro/edo/edo10.htm

messages.messageBody:
Hi.

If you want to assert Berne Convention copyright, then maybe you should
be attaching a Berne Convention copyright notice. These notices
typically contain the copyright symbol, the year, and the name of the
owner.
